Water tank analogy showing customer churn rate calculation and financial impact
placeholderImages.caption: Churn directly impacts revenue: A 5% monthly churn equals 46% annual customer loss

placeholderImages.description: Step-by-step churn rate calculation formulas with example: customer churn, revenue churn, and net churn
placeholderImages.caption: Progressive complexity: From basic customer count to revenue-adjusted churn metrics

placeholderImages.description: Industry churn rate benchmarks: SaaS 10%, E-commerce 15%, Telecom 20%, Financial 8%, Subscription 25% with healthy/danger zones
placeholderImages.caption: Industry benchmarks help contextualize your churn rate - SaaS requires different calculation than retail

placeholderImages.description: A leaky bucket graphic with coins falling out, symbolizing SaaS churn and lost revenue, with a hand patching a hole.
placeholderImages.caption: Effective churn prevention transforms your business from a leaky bucket into a compounding growth engine.

placeholderImages.description: A customer journey map on a whiteboard showing key touchpoints for onboarding optimization to prevent early churn.
placeholderImages.caption: Optimizing the first 21 days of onboarding is critical, as it determines up to 80% of long-term customer retention.

placeholderImages.description: A dashboard showing customer health scores segmented by color (green, yellow, red) for targeted retention efforts.
placeholderImages.caption: Data-driven segmentation allows for surgical retention efforts, focusing resources on at-risk accounts for maximum impact.
